title: What are some easy songs to play on the flute? - Quora

response.answer_text: For lack of any further specificity in your question(s), I assume you mean unaccompanied, id est, playing the primary melody or theme of an instrumental composition, or what is usually the vocal part of a song arrangement, as opposed to the flute part within an orchestral arrangement. I also assume you seek classic selections from the contemporary popular music canon. One of the greatest aspects of flutistry is that flute can play the melodyof nearly any song written for guitar and/or piano, without need for music written specifically for flute. You just follow the first piano or vocal line. Here are a several well known popular songs from the past several decades that are easy to master as well as to memorize, in a variety of styles and genres: Title/Composer(s): "Basin Street Blues" - Spencer Williams, notably recorded by Louis"Satchmo" Armstrong "Baby Face" - Harry Akst/Benny Davis "Let It Be" - Paul McCartney "Don't Cry for Me Argentina" - Andrew Lloyd Webber/Tim Rice "Over the Rainbow" - Harold Arlen/E.Y. Harburg "Stairway to Heaven" - Jimmy Page/Robert Plant "The Rose" - Amanda McBroom "Desperado" - Glenn Frey/Don Henley "I Will Always Love You" - Dolly Parton "Bridge over Troubled Water" - Paul Simon "Killing Me Softly with His Song" - Charles Fox/Norman Gimbel "Another Brick in the Wall, Pt. II" - Roger Waters "Wish You Were Here" - Roger Waters/David Gilmour "Superstar" - Leon Russell/Bonnie Bramlett/Delaney Bramlett "Ode to Billie Joe" - Bobbie Gentry "Dancing Queen" - Benny Andersson/Stig Andersson/Bjorn Ulvaeus "Bye Bye Love" - Boudleaux Bryant/Felice Bryant "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" - Mick Jagger/Keith Richards "Bitter Sweet Symphony" - Mick Jagger/Keith Richards/Richard Ashcroft "Karma Chameleon" - George O'Dowd/Jon Moss/Mikey Craig/Roy Hay/Phil Pickett "All Alone Am I" - Arthur Altman/Manos Hadjidakis "Take a Bow" - Madonna/Babyface This ought to keep you busy for a while.

Mary had a little lamb. Row Row Row your boat. Twinkle Twinkle Little Star. Really any nursery rhymes are good to start of with. After you master those, you can look up some Irish flute songs. Those are awesome.
